repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

body: Hi, can i work on this issue? i'm a newbie so some help is appreciated.Could you please explain the issue in detail.

@SaiHarshaK 
It is about writing tests for the fix(es) in #4440.
I would like to try working on this issue. Is there any update as to whether any acceptance tests have already been written for the fix(es) in #4440 at this time? Thanks!
@davidfyu  @SaiHarshaK  Either of you working on this ?

I am also interested in working on this, but i don't really get what the fixes in #4440 are ?! Does it mean the introduction of the `stacklevel=somenumber` in `_issue_config_warning`? I need some clarification and help for starting :)

Edit: While skimming through the code i found that that `_issue_config_warning` was renamed to `_issue_warning_captured`

issue.title: Added acceptance tests for 'config warnings' stacklevel

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

body:
Hi @xibalba01,

Sorry for not answering this, I must have missed the notification about this issue.

The tests are supposed to produce the warnings adjusted by #4440, for example, creating a test case where a module which was supposed to be rewritten is already imported, so the *Module already imported so cannot be rewritten* warning is issued, and make sure it points to a reasonable location instead of deep inside pytest's internals.

Looking at #4440, most of those have been removed by now, there are only a few left.
@nicoddemus Thanks for the explanation! Are there already some acceptance tests available that i could have a look at to know in which direction this should go?

@nicoddemus @RonnyPfannschmidt @blueyed  I am still trying to understand how this will work... A bit more details would be really nice :) In the end these specific warnings in mentioned in #4440 need to be triggered, right? But exactly this is where i am struggeling... How to trigger these warnings?
